name: Galois group
rephrased: Galois groups are groups associated with field extensions that describe the symmetries of the roots of certain polynomials, forming the foundation of Galois theory.
explained: A Galois group is the group of automorphisms of a Galois extension, which is a field extension that is both normal and separable. It is the set of all field automorphisms that fix the base field element-wise and map the extension field to itself. The fundamental theorem of Galois theory establishes a one-to-one correspondence between the subgroups of the Galois group and the intermediate fields of the extension. This group captures the symmetry of the roots of a polynomial defining the extension.
related_conjectures: Inverse Galois Problem: The conjecture that every finite group is the Galois group of some Galois extension of the rational numbers.
Langlands program: A vast web of conjectures connecting number theory, representation theory, and algebraic geometry, involving Galois representations.
